com.mapquest.android.maps
Class RouteManager

java.lang.Object
  com.mapquest.android.maps.RouteManager

public class RouteManager
extends java.lang.Object

The RouteManager is a wrapper around Directions Service used to add routes to a mapView including both the route ribbon and the route locations and generate itineraries.
Notes:

  • Locations passed in must be in one of the formats the directions service expects. See Location Format Documentation
  • Options must be specified in the format the direction service expects. See Options Format Documenation

    • Usage:


    You must instantiate this with a context derived from a MapActivity using new RouteManager(Context context) or by passing an APIKey to the constructor new RouteManager(Context context, String apiKey)
    You must set one or more of the following:
  • setMapView(MapView) - doing this will create a route ribbon and add route locations to the map
  • setItineraryView(WebView) - doing this will generate a route itinerary or narrative in the given webView
  • setRouteCallback(RouteCallback)- doing this will raise callback events

    • Optional:

  • The RouteManager will handle ambiguities when setIgnoreAmbiguities(false) by prompting the user with a list of Locations that potentially match the given location. Upon selection from the dialog the RouteManager will resubmit the route with the resolved location. If you want to handle ambiguity resolution in your code use setHandleAmbiguities(false) and use a RouteManager.RouteCallback and implement the onError method to detect statusCode 610 (ambiguity) and handle appropriately.
  • Sub-classing this route manager will give you a bit more control over how things are added to the mapView and/or itinerary WebView. see buildHTMLItinerary(RouteResponse), buildLocationsItemizedOverlay(List), #buildLocationOverlayItem(Location, int), buildRouteOverlay(RouteResponse), addEventHandlersLocationsItemizedOverlay(ItemizedOverlay), and addEventHandlersRouteOverlay(Overlay)

    Method Detail

    setHandleAmbiguities

    public void setHandleAmbiguities(boolean handleAmbiguities)
    If you have called setIgnoreAmbiguities(boolean) then you can turn on the ability to handle user interaction to resolve any ambiguity that may have come up.

    Parameters:
    handleAmbiguities - defaults to true

    setIgnoreAmbiguities

    public void setIgnoreAmbiguities(boolean ignoreAmbiguities)
    By default the RouteManager will try to ignore ambiguities and give you the best match for the search, if you would like to disable this you can set it to false and you will get an errorCallback if you have not used setHandleAmbiguities(boolean)

    Parameters:
    ignoreAmbiguities - defaults to true

    setOptions

    public void setOptions(java.lang.String options)
    Sets the options used for the route request. When these are set there are items that we will override and/or add to the request: -shapeFormat: we will always use cmp6
    -generalize: will always be set to 0
    -optionally if a mapView is supplied we will provide the mapState -optionally if a webView is supplied we will set the narrativeType to HTML

    Parameters:
    options - see Options Formation Documenation for more information

    setMapView

    public void setMapView(MapView mapView)
    If given a mapView the routeManager will add the route and locations to this map

    Parameters:
    mapView -

    setBestFitRoute

    public void setBestFitRoute(boolean bestFitRoute)
    if a mapView is supplied and bestFitRoute=true, the mapView will be zoomed and centered to the route

    Parameters:
    bestFitRoute - default is true

    setRouteRibbonPaint

    public void setRouteRibbonPaint(android.graphics.Paint routeRibbonPaint)
    Sets the paint used to create the route ribbon if a mapView is supplied The default looks like this:

    Paint routeRibbonPaint = new Paint(Paint.ANTI_ALIAS_FLAG);
    routeRibbonPaint.setColor(Color.BLUE);
    routeRibbonPaint.setAlpha(100);
    routeRibbonPaint.setStyle(Paint.Style.STROKE);
    routeRibbonPaint.setStrokeJoin(Paint.Join.ROUND);
    routeRibbonPaint.setStrokeCap(Paint.Cap.ROUND);
    routeRibbonPaint.setStrokeWidth(5);

    Parameters:
    routeRibbonPaint -

    buildLocationOverlayItem

    protected OverlayItem buildLocationOverlayItem(RouteResponse.Location location,
                                               int index)
    By default each location along your route will get added to the map. You can override this method if you need more control over how the locations on the route are added to the map.

    Parameters:
    location - location along the route
    index - of the location 0=starting location
    Returns:
    OverlayItem
